post_project.models module

class post_project.models.Project(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a project posted by a user.

This model stores information about projects posted by users, including the user who posted it, project name, category, description, bid price range, attached file (if any), and date posted.

user

The user who posted the project.

Type:

ForeignKey

project_name

The name of the project.

Type:

CharField

category

The category of the project.

Type:

CharField

The description of the project.

Type:

TextField

min_bid_price

The minimum bid price for the project.

Type:

PositiveIntegerField

max_bid_price

The maximum bid price for the project.

Type:

PositiveIntegerField

file_doc

The attached file for the project (if any).

Type:

FileField

posted_on

The date when the project was posted.

Type:

DateField

category

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

file_doc

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)

user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

test_post_project_login()[source]

Test accessing the post_project view while logged in.

Asserts that the response status code is 200 and the correct template is used.

test_post_project_logout()[source]

Test accessing the post_project view while logged out.

Asserts that the response is a redirect to the login page.

test_post_project_post_max_less_than_min()[source]

Test posting a project with max price less than min price.

Asserts that no project is created and the correct template is used.

test_post_project_post_missing_file()[source]

Test posting a project with missing file.

Asserts that no project is created and the correct template is used.

test_post_project_post_negative_prices()[source]

Test posting a project with negative prices.

Asserts that no project is created and the correct template is used.

test_post_project_post_non_numeric_prices()[source]

Test posting a project with non-numeric prices.

Asserts that no project is created and the correct template is used.

test_post_project_post_not_authenticated()[source]

Test posting a project when user is not authenticated.

Asserts that the response is a redirect to the login page.

test_post_project_post_success()[source]

Test posting a project successfully.

Asserts that a project is created, file is uploaded, and response is a redirect.

test_postproject_url_resolves()[source]

Test that the ‘postproject’ URL resolves to the correct view.

Asserts that the resolved view function is post_project.

post_project.urls module

post_project.views module

post_project.views.post_project(request)[source]

View function for posting a project.

This function allows authenticated users to post a new project. It handles POST requests containing project details, validates the form data, creates a new project object, and saves it to the database. If the request method is GET, it renders the project posting form.

Validation and Error Handling: - Ensures min_price and max_price are numeric. - Checks that min_price is not greater than max_price. - Validates the presence of an attached file.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

If the request method is POST and the form data is valid, redirects the user to the client projects page. If there are validation errors, renders the project posting form with errors. If the request method is GET, renders the project posting form.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Raises:

ValueError – If min_price or max_price cannot be converted to an integer.

Template:

post_project/postproject.html

Context:

  • min_price (int): The minimum bid price, pre-filled if validation fails.

  • max_price (int): The maximum bid price, pre-filled if validation fails.

  • errors (dict): A dictionary of field-specific error messages.
